name: Jason Mitchell
title: Software Engineer
summary: Software Engineer at The Home Depot working in Inventory Planning & Replenishment (IPR) HealthTech Systems. I went from a coding bootcamp to building enterprise systems at scale. I specialize in Java, React, and Python, and I'm passionate about building things that work well and solving real problems.

career_timeline.description: Intensive full-stack engineering program covering modern software development practices, enterprise architecture patterns, and collaborative engineering workflows.
Applied engineering fundamentals in a production environment, gaining hands-on experience with enterprise Java and React applications supporting supply chain operations.

career_timeline.company: The Home Depot — IPR HealthTech Systems
career_timeline.description: Contributing to enterprise applications within Inventory Planning & Replenishment, delivering production features, bug fixes, deployment workflows, and monitoring solutions across backend and frontend systems.

key_contributions.detail: Contributed to enterprise Java and React applications supporting import container and replenishment workflows that power Home Depot's supply chain.
Implemented a Python-based PDF generation solution to automate and standardize production container documentation, replacing manual processes.
Designed and created multiple production deployment workflows for legacy applications, improving release reliability and repeatability across the team.
Designed and implemented application monitoring using Grafana, building dashboards to surface system health, failures, and operational metrics.
Delivered critical production bug fixes across backend and frontend systems in live environments, ensuring minimal downtime and service reliability.
Supported keep-the-lights-on operations including incident triage, defect resolution, and deployment support in an Agile cross-functional environment.

portfolio_projects.name: Portfolio Website
portfolio_projects.description: Dark terminal-themed portfolio with creative/professional mode toggle, state-driven architecture with custom AppState manager, no frameworks — pure vanilla JS. Features cursor glow effects, typing animations, whiteboard annotation overlay, and integrated analytics dashboard with live Prometheus metrics.

portfolio_projects.name: Lumber Yard Restock Planner
portfolio_projects.description: Interactive 3D lumber yard demo with 20 product bunks. Users browse and flag bunks for restocking, then generate a full PDF delivery order. Features 3D-rendered flatbed truck diagram showing bin-packed loading, yard health bar chart, and order summary. Built with Three.js r128 with individual board layers, sticker separators, and banding straps.

portfolio_projects.name: AI Recruiter Chatbot
portfolio_projects.description: An AI-powered chatbot integrated into my portfolio that lets recruiters ask questions about my experience and paste job postings for honest fit assessments. Uses a pre-trained LLM with prompt engineering — demonstrating practical AI integration skills.

strengths: Strong enterprise Java and React experience in a Fortune 500 production environment
Comfortable across the full stack — frontend, backend, DevOps, and observability
Self-taught drive — went from bootcamp to shipping production features
Good at automating manual processes (PDF generation, deployment workflows)
Solid debugging skills in production environments
Experience with monitoring and observability (Grafana, Prometheus)
Creative problem solver — built 3D visualizations and interactive demos as portfolio pieces
areas_for_growth: Still growing in system design for large-scale distributed architectures
Cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Azure) — have exposure but not deep hands-on yet
Kubernetes and container orchestration — aware of concepts but haven't worked with it in production
Database design at scale — have worked with databases but not as a primary focus
AI/ML — integrating APIs and prompt engineering, but not building models from scratch

what_im_looking_for: I'm looking for a software engineering role where I can keep growing technically, work on meaningful problems, and contribute to a team that values quality and collaboration. I'm open to backend, frontend, or full-stack roles. I thrive in environments where I can learn from senior engineers and take on increasing responsibility.
personality_notes: I'm a hard worker who takes pride in what I build. I went the non-traditional route — bootcamp instead of a CS degree — and I've worked to prove myself every step of the way. I like going deep on problems and building things that are polished, not just functional. Outside of work, I'm always tinkering with side projects to learn new technologies.
